reviewDetails.comment: Dr Rachko is a good listener, has good humor, and instills confidence.
Very pleasant doctor; wonderful bedside manners AND listens to anything that you say to him!
he's the best

Dr. Rachko takes the time to explain everything properly.  He also is interested in your other tests you are having done with other doctors. He will  review your test results from them and explain how they pertain to your heart health. He also responds very promptly to you questions using MyChart.
Very kind and reassuring. I felt very comfortable and informed
Very friendly and provided good service

reviewDetails.comment: Dr. Virzi possesses the exceptional skill of articulating intricate medical jargon in an easily understandable manner. During my appointment, I did not feel hurried. He devoted ample time to address my concerns while exhibiting a highly personable and pleasant demeanor, complete with a tasteful touch of humor. I highly endorse him as a medical practitioner.

Dr. Virzi is the best Cardiologist doctor I’ve seen in awhile. Being under his care he has helped me with many bad symptoms when I suffered from having high blood pressure. He has cured me from this and I’m thankful for him!
He is by far the best cardiologist I have seen. Knowledgeable with wonderful bed side manners

Dr Virzi I would highly recommend to family & friends. Very professional, extremely knowledgeable, patient, kind, & helpful!!  I thank 
God! For gifting him to be able help his patients.
Great doctor, would keep visiting and recommend to anyone.
Dr Virzi is wonderful.  Thorough, kind, explains everything very clearly.  I've recommended him to my other doctors.
He is incredibly thorough and caring. I have been going to him for years and I highly recommend him
He is thorough, knowledgeable, takes time to answer questions. I recommended him to my mother and brother.
Dr. Virzi is patience , well knowledge and listen to his patients.

reviewDetails.comment: If you are seeing Dr. Gordon, ASK the office how much the appointment will be and what your insurance will cover because he charges an astronomically unreasonable amount of $660 just for an office visit. His Nurse Practitioner/Medical Assistant gave me an X-Ray before even seeing Dr. Gordon and I barely saw him for 5 minutes. Do not recommend.

I met with him on Nov. 4th for the first time - he was to set up 3 appointments for a special knee treatment and he. said it would be set up from the office.  I called two weeks afy=ter the Nov4 business to be told there was no information to confirm this.   They said they would correct it and get back to me.  They never did.  I called again to ask where I stand and was told they were trying to see if Cygna would pay for it.  I phoned yet againon Monday and was first tole that no request  to Cygna was made.  They called me back  right from Dr.Gordon`s office and  was told , after I told themi I would find another physician.  They said the request had been denied and that they were going to request again.    It is now December 13th and no response.    I do not blame Dr. Gordon, but rather the Mt. Sinai system.
Very professional and quickly solved my problem

His attention to details w/knowledge & patients
Was refreshen
So expensive. The wait was insanely long and honestly didn’t get much out of it
nice guy but always in a rush

reviewDetails.comment: She diligently works to find the best solution to health issues that arise from time to time.
Dr.Kimura always gives me the most appropriate treatment and timely access to my care.

The treatment of prescription from Dr. Kimura was sloppy.
She missed twice for three medicines and as result I had to buy additional medicine and costed $20 more than normal case.
She said sorry but very light touch, without any sincere apologize I felt.
She always tries to help you promptly when you need it.
Kindness support and appropriate guidance.

reviewDetails.comment: Dr Adler is a superb physician! I had seen many dermatologists prior to him, and none of them cured my acne. I’m so glad I found him! My skin is doing really well and I’m so grateful!

Between visit 1 & visit 2, Dr. Adler gave me contradicting information and diagnosis.  In the second visit,  I told Dr. Adler that I don’t like to take antibiotics unless really needed. He told me the pill he prescribed was an anti inflammatory drug. It was an actually an antibiotic. I left with no information on how to treat my condition besides put on the ointment and take a pill. That’s not how bodies work.
Dr. Adler is one of them most caring Dermatologist I know.  He listens and addresses your issues and concerns as he see fit.  Very personable and caring Dr.
I felt at ease with Dr. Adler, showed great professionalism.

reviewDetails.comment: Dr Strachan is a competent and skilled doctor. Her demeanor, lack of empathy and sometimes darn right dismissive attitude are a huge turnoff.
My daughters and I have been a patients  for over  10 years and have experienced drastic results for our acne and other issues.   I haughty recommend Dr Strachan.
Dr Strachan was ver beneficial in reducing my ache breakouts.  I have a new level of confidence based on her regimen. [PERSONAL INFO]
Great office, great Doctor.
Dr Strachan is very professional and explains any issues with detail and concern. No wait time,  friendly staff and clean office.

She was relatively rude when I tried to ask questions that she wouldn’t answer. After all I pay her for answering questions that I have and she refused some of them. 

I will be requesting a refund.
Dirty office, rude doctor, total waste of time.

It was difficult for me to find a doctor who dealt with hair loss, particularly for  African American woman.  Dr. Strachen was careful to examine my scalp and hair. The extended staff was helpful in finding a pharmacy that is convenient and suitable for me.
